abstract: The chief executive of BP, Tony Hayward, said Thursday that the company was committed to staying in Russia, even as its joint venture, TNK-BP, came under fresh pressure from the authorities investigating accusations of tax evasion.
lead_paragraph: The chief executive of BP, Tony Hayward, said Thursday that the company was committed to staying in Russia, even as its joint venture, TNK-BP, came under fresh pressure from the authorities investigating accusations of tax evasion.

headline.main: BP Says It Is Committed to Russian Venture
